alert.note: Alert for Bexar (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 22 at 10:12AM CST by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following county, Bexar. * WHEN...Until 115 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1012 AM CST, the public reported heavy rain in Salado Creek at Loop 410. due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - Salado Creek at Loop 410. is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Antonio, Stinson Municipal Airport, Kirby, Somerset, Elmendorf, China Grove, Calaveras Lake, Sandy Oaks, Buena Vista, Southton, Brooks City Base, Mitchell Lake, Losoya, Braunig Lake, Thelma, Martinez, Sayers and Parita. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
